alert.note: Alert for Schuylkill (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 10 at 4:53AM EST until December 11 at 12:00PM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following county, Schuylkill. * WHEN...From 1 PM EST this afternoon through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - With generally dry soil conditions and near to below average streamflows over east-central Pennsylvania, rainfall will be largely beneficial in nature. However, with isolated rainfall totals up to 2.5 inches expected, there may be some localized flooding. The threat of flash flooding is low given modest rainfall rates less than 1 inch per hour, but isolated urban, poor drainage, and small stream flooding is possible. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
